subject: Technology
description: Members of eBay are being made to change their passwords after a cyber-attack compromised a database containing user information.

description: Activision Blizzard is trying to sue the creators of cheats that allow Starcraft II players to improve their rankings and unlock new weapons.

description: Police have told Newsbeat they are increasingly concerned about people using social media and video apps while driving.

description: Battersea Dogs and Cats Home says the PetMatch app risks turning animals into "disposable items".

subject: Technology
description: Chinese online retailer JD.com raises $1.8bn in its US share sale, valuing the company at more $25bn according to underwriters Bank of America and UBS Investment Bank.
title: China's JD.com to debut on Nasdaq

subject: Technology
description: The FBI's director says the agency is considering hiring cannabis-smoking hackers despite a ban on the drug's use, according to reports.

subject: Technology
description: The first automatic ads on Facebook are expected to begin playing on UK users' timelines within weeks.

subject: Technology
description: Computer and Video Games, which in 1981 was the world's first magazine dedicated to gaming, is facing closure.

description: The UK's data privacy watchdog says it will based its view on what search links should be removed on evidence of "damage and distress".

description: Netflix announces plans to extend its TV and movie streaming service to Germany, France and four other European countries.

description: Beijing bans the use of Windows 8 on government computers as a reaction to the firm's decision to stop supporting its older XP operating system.

description: Travel-rating service Trip Advisor is being investigated in Italy over concerns the site is not doing enough to prevent fake reviews.

description: The world's biggest personal computer maker posts a 29% jump in full year net profit while at the same time extending its position as market leader in the PC industry.

description: Openreach needs to speed up repairs for telephone line faults and broadband installation, Ofcom has ruled.

description: The French train operator SNCF has discovered that 2,000 new trains it ordered at a cost of 15bn euros are too wide for many regional platforms.
